Meta.name: description
Meta.MetaString: This dataset contains tax revenue collected by Mexico. It provides detailed tax revenues by sector (Supranational, Federal or Central Government, State or Lander Government, Local Government, and Social Security Funds) and by specific tax, such as capital gains, profits and income, property, sales, etc.

Meta.name: ispartof_serial_description_en
Meta.MetaString: OECD Tax Statistics are published in two volumes: The Revenue Statistics database provides detailed information on tax and other government revenues broken down by type of tax or revenue and level of government. Data are provided for the period 1975 onwards for all OECD countries. Country data are normally provided in national currencies. Comparable data tables show taxation and social security contributions as a percentage of GDP. The Taxing Wages database provides information on taxes paid and benefits received by workers under 8 different income and family composition situations. Data mainly refer to recent years, but some comparative tables also present statistics of interest over the period 1979 to 2003. Data are provided for all OECD countries in national currency values.

Meta.name: description
Meta.MetaString: This dataset contains tax revenue collected by Mexico. It provides detailed tax revenues by sector (Supranational, Federal or Central Government, State or Lander Government, Local Government, and Social Security Funds) and by specific tax, such as capital gains, profits and income, property, sales, etc.

Meta.name: ispartof_serial_description_en
Meta.MetaString: OECD Tax Statistics are published in two volumes: The Revenue Statistics database provides detailed information on tax and other government revenues broken down by type of tax or revenue and level of government. Data are provided for the period 1975 onwards for all OECD countries. Country data are normally provided in national currencies. Comparable data tables show taxation and social security contributions as a percentage of GDP. The Taxing Wages database provides information on taxes paid and benefits received by workers under 8 different income and family composition situations. Data mainly refer to recent years, but some comparative tables also present statistics of interest over the period 1979 to 2003. Data are provided for all OECD countries in national currency values.

Meta.name: description
Meta.MetaString: The OECD Factbook database includes data selected from more than 40 statistical databases illustrating the demographic, social, economic and environmental developments for all OECD member countries as well as Brazil, China, India, Indonesia, Russia, and South Africa. Topics covered include population and migration; production and productivity; household income, wealth and debt; globalisation, trade and foreign direct investment (FDI); prices, interest rates and exchange rates; energy and transportation; labour, employment and unemployment; science and technology including research and development (R&D) and information and communications technology (ICT); environment including natural resources, water, air and climate; education resources and outcomes; general government expenditures, debt, revenues, taxes, social protection, agricultural support and foreign aid; and health status, health risks and health resources.

Meta.name: ispartof_serial_description_en
Meta.MetaString:
The OECD Factbook Statistics database includes data selected from more than 40 statistical databases illustrating the demographic, social, economic and environmental developments for its member countries and major additional countries.  The user can easily compare each indicator for a country with those of other OECD countries.

OECD Countries covered include Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Chile,Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Poland, Portugal, Slovak Republic, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Non-OECD countries covered include Brazil, China, India, Indonesia, Russia, and South Africa.

Topics covered include population and migration; production and productivity; household income, wealth and debt; globalisation, trade and foreign direct investment (FDI); prices, interest rates and exchange rates; energy and transportation; labour, employment and unemployment; science and technology including research and development (R&D) and the Information and Communications Technology (ICT) sector; environment including natural resoures, water,and  air and climate; education resources and outcomes; government expenditures, debt, revenues, taxes, agricultural support and foreign aid; and health status, risk and resources.

Meta.name: description
Meta.MetaString: This dataset contains more than 100 indicators which cover a wide range of areas: agriculture, economic production, education, energy, environment, foreign aid, health, industry, information and communications, international trade, labour force, population, taxation, public expenditure, and R&D. This year's focus topic is gender.

Meta.name: ispartof_serial_description_en
Meta.MetaString:
The OECD Factbook Statistics database includes data selected from more than 40 statistical databases illustrating the demographic, social, economic and environmental developments for its member countries and major additional countries.  The user can easily compare each indicator for a country with those of other OECD countries.

OECD Countries covered include Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Chile,Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Poland, Portugal, Slovak Republic, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Non-OECD countries covered include Brazil, China, India, Indonesia, Russia, and South Africa.

Topics covered include population and migration; production and productivity; household income, wealth and debt; globalisation, trade and foreign direct investment (FDI); prices, interest rates and exchange rates; energy and transportation; labour, employment and unemployment; science and technology including research and development (R&D) and the Information and Communications Technology (ICT) sector; environment including natural resoures, water,and  air and climate; education resources and outcomes; government expenditures, debt, revenues, taxes, agricultural support and foreign aid; and health status, risk and resources.

Meta.name: description
Meta.MetaString: The indicators dataset includes more than 100 indicators on population, economic production, foreign trade and investment, energy, labour force, information and communications, public finances, innovation, the environment, foreign aid, agriculture, taxation, education, health. This year, to commemorate the OECD 50th anniversary, the OECD Factbook features a focus on 50 years of OECD statistics.

Meta.name: ispartof_serial_description_en
Meta.MetaString:

OECD Countries covered include Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Chile,Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Poland, Portugal, Slovak Republic, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Topics covered include population and migration; production and productivity; household income, wealth and debt; globalisation, trade and foreign direct investment (FDI); prices, interest rates and exchange rates; energy and transportation; labour, employment and unemployment; science and technology including research and development (R&D) and the Information and Communications Technology (ICT) sector; environment including natural resoures, water,and  air and climate; education resources and outcomes; government expenditures, debt, revenues, taxes, agricultural support and foreign aid; and health status, risk and resources.

Meta.name: description
Meta.MetaString: This dataset is the OECD Factbook 2010 special focus and it brings together a range of statistics relevant for the analysis of the crisis, of its build-up and, where data are available, of its aftermath.

Meta.MetaString:
The OECD Factbook Statistics database includes data selected from more than 40 statistical databases illustrating the demographic, social, economic and environmental developments for its member countries and major additional countries.  The user can easily compare each indicator for a country with those of other OECD countries.

OECD Countries covered include Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Chile,Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Poland, Portugal, Slovak Republic, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Non-OECD countries covered include Brazil, China, India, Indonesia, Russia, and South Africa.

Topics covered include population and migration; production and productivity; household income, wealth and debt; globalisation, trade and foreign direct investment (FDI); prices, interest rates and exchange rates; energy and transportation; labour, employment and unemployment; science and technology including research and development (R&D) and the Information and Communications Technology (ICT) sector; environment including natural resoures, water,and  air and climate; education resources and outcomes; government expenditures, debt, revenues, taxes, agricultural support and foreign aid; and health status, risk and resources.

Meta.name: description
Meta.MetaString: The indicators dataset includes more than 100 indicators on population, economic production, foreign trade and investment, energy, labour force, information and communications, public finances, innovation, the environment, foreign aid, agriculture, taxation, education, health and quality of life. Data are provided for all OECD member countries with area totals, and in some cases, for selected non-member economies.

Meta.name: ispartof_serial_description_en
Meta.MetaString:
The OECD Factbook Statistics database includes data selected from more than 40 statistical databases illustrating the demographic, social, economic and environmental developments for its member countries and major additional countries.  The user can easily compare each indicator for a country with those of other OECD countries.

OECD Countries covered include Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Chile,Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Poland, Portugal, Slovak Republic, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Non-OECD countries covered include Brazil, China, India, Indonesia, Russia, and South Africa.

Topics covered include population and migration; production and productivity; household income, wealth and debt; globalisation, trade and foreign direct investment (FDI); prices, interest rates and exchange rates; energy and transportation; labour, employment and unemployment; science and technology including research and development (R&D) and the Information and Communications Technology (ICT) sector; environment including natural resoures, water,and  air and climate; education resources and outcomes; government expenditures, debt, revenues, taxes, agricultural support and foreign aid; and health status, risk and resources.

Meta.name: description
Meta.MetaString: The OECD Factbook Statistics 2006 dataset includes more than 100 indicators on population and migration, macroeconomic trends, economic globalisation, prices, labour market, science and technology, environment, education, public policies and quality of life. Data are provided for all OECD member countries with area totals, and in some cases, for selected non-member economies. This dataset provides statistics for each of the 30 member countries and for the BRICS countries a broad selection of indicators, illustrating the demographic, social, economic and environmental developments and projections until 2020.

Meta.name: description
Meta.MetaString: The OECD Factbook Statistics 2007 dataset includes more than 100 indicators on population and migration, macroeconomic trends, economic globalisation, prices, labour market, science and technology, environment, education, public policies and quality life. Data are provided for all OECD member countries with area totals, and in some cases, for selected non-member economies. This dataset provides statistics for each of the 30 member countries, Slovenia and for the BRICS countries a broad selection of indicators, illustrating the demographic, social, economic and environmental developments and projections until 2033.
